description: mounted on ivory paper; study for a sculpture of a standing male in a contrapposto pose, with PL arm held up; each hand holding a staff; figure stands on a dolphin on top of a base with shells and foliate swags; another smaller figure study in same pose at right; study of a hand holding a staff in red chalk at left
medium: Pen and black ink and gray wash, brown ink and red chalk on laid paper
provenance: Sale, Sotheby's, London, December 7, 1976, no. 31, for Â£2,300, to Tan Bunzl; [Yvonne Tan Bunzl, London; 1976-80; sold for $2,478, to Moir]; Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1980-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
title: Study for a Fountain of Neptune
